main_definition: To group or bundle items together, often in a tightly organized manner.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To gather (animals) together for traveling or migration purposes
meanings_and_examples.example: The wildebeest start their annual migration by packing themselves together and heading towards the watering holes.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To put items in a container, bag, or group tightly and neatly
meanings_and_examples.example: She carefully packed her clothes into the suitcase to make traveling easier.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To engage with others in a conversation, typically by discussing a particular topic repeatedly
meanings_and_examples.example: The friends gathered at the cafe and began to pack on the subject of their favorite books.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A group of people moving or traveling together
meanings_and_examples.example: The hikers formed a pack and started trekking along the mountain trail.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To smuggle goods in violation of law, often concealed in large quantities
meanings_and_examples.example: The criminals were arrested for attempting to pack drugs into their vehicle without proper documentation.
